parameters.name: Category
parameters.description:
The content type of the sensitive data detection rule. Valid values:

*   **2**: regular expression
*   **3**: algorithm
*   **5**: keyword

parameters.name: Content
parameters.description: The content of the sensitive data detection rule. You can specify a regular expression, an algorithm, or keywords that are used to match sensitive fields or text.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description:
The ID of the sensitive data detection rule.

You can call the [DescribeRules](~~DescribeRules~~) operation to obtain the rule ID.

parameters.name: Lang
parameters.description:
The language of the content within the request and response. Default value: **zh_cn**. Valid values:

*   **zh_cn**: Simplified Chinese
*   **en_us**: English

parameters.name: MatchType
parameters.description:
The match type. Valid values:

*   **1**: rule-based match
*   **2**: dictionary-based match

parameters.name: ModelRuleIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the models for sensitive data audit.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description:
The name of the sensitive data detection rule.

You can call the [DescribeRules](~~DescribeRules~~) operation to obtain the rule name.

parameters.name: ProductCode
parameters.description: The service to which the sensitive data detection rule is applied. Valid values include **MaxCompute, OSS, ADS, OTS, and RDS**.

parameters.name: ProductId
parameters.description: The ID of the service to which the sensitive data detection rule is applied. Valid values include **1**, **2**, **3**, **4**, and **5**. The value 1 indicates MaxCompute. The value 2 indicates Object Storage Service (OSS). The value 3 indicates AnalyticDB for MySQL. The value 4 indicates Tablestore. The value 5 indicates ApsaraDB RDS.

parameters.name: RiskLevelId
parameters.description:
The sensitivity level of the sensitive data that hits the sensitive data detection rule. Valid values:

*   **1**: N/A, which indicates that no sensitive data is detected.
*   **2**: S1, which indicates the low sensitivity level.
*   **3**: S2, which indicates the medium sensitivity level.
*   **4**: S3, which indicates the high sensitivity level.
*   **5**: S4, which indicates the highest sensitivity level.

parameters.name: RuleType
parameters.description:
The type of the sensitive data detection rule. Valid values:

*   **1**: data detection rule
*   **2**: audit rule
*   **3**: anomalous event detection rule

parameters.name: SupportForm
parameters.description:
The data assets supported by the sensitive data detection rule. Valid values:

*   **0**: all data assets
*   **1**: structured data assets
*   **2**: unstructured data assets

parameters.name: TemplateRuleIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the templates that are used to audit sensitive data.

parameters.name: WarnLevel
parameters.description:
The risk level of the alert that is triggered by the sensitive data detection rule. Valid values:

*   **1**: low level
*   **2**: medium level
*   **3**: high level
